Class Database

java.lang.Object
Database
public class Database extends Object
Contains all functionality to access the SQL Database

      private ResultSet runCommand(String sqlStatement) throws SQLException
      Runs a SQL command on the database and returns the results as a ResultSet.
      Parameters:
      sqlStatement - the SQL command to run
      Returns:
      a ResultSet object containing the results of the query
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is an error executing the SQL command

      Returns:
      an integer value representing the number of rows in the table
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an error executing the query

    • inventoryItemsUsed

      public ArrayList<Integer> inventoryItemsUsed(String date)
      This method is part of a class that interacts with a database and is used to retrieve a list of inventory items (and quantities) used on a specific day. The inventory items are obtained from the RecipeItem and ItemSold tables, which store the recipes and sales data for menu items, respectively. The method returns an ArrayList of integers, where each index represents an inventory item ID and the value at that index represents the total quantity of the inventory item used on the specified day.
      Parameters:
      date - a string representing the date for which to retrieve the inventory items used
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of integers representing the inventory items used on the specified day

    • get20RowsInventory

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Inventory> get20RowsInventory(int whichTwenty)
      Get blocks of 20 Rows in any table based on specified table name and converts to array list
      Parameters:
      whichTwenty - integer representing the desired block of twenty items in the inventory table
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of Inventory objects representing the retrieved rows of inventory items.

    • get20RowsMenu

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Menu> get20RowsMenu(int whichTwenty)
      Retrieves 20 rows of menu items from the "menu" table starting from a specified position.
      Parameters:
      whichTwenty - An integer specifying which set of 20 rows to retrieve. The first set of 20 rows would be 1, the second set would be 2, and so on.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList of Menu objects representing the retrieved rows of menu items.

    • getExcess

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Excess> getExcess(String initialDate, String finalDate)
      Retrieves a list of items that have used less than 10% of their inventory in the given timeframe
      Parameters:
      initialDate - the start date for this measure.
      finalDate - the end date for this measure. use current date for the most up to date measurement.
      Returns:
      list of items

    • get20RowsRecipe

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Recipe> get20RowsRecipe(int whichTwenty)
      Retrieves 20 rows of recipe items from the "recipe_item" table starting from a specified position.
      Parameters:
      whichTwenty - An integer specifying which set of 20 rows to retrieve. The first set of 20 rows would be 1, the second set would be 2, and so on.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList of Recipe objects representing the retrieved rows of recipe items.

    • get20RowsReport

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Report> get20RowsReport(int whichTwenty)
      Retrieves 20 rows of recipe items from the report table starting from a specified position.
      Parameters:
      whichTwenty - An integer specifying which set of 20 rows to retrieve. The first set of 20 rows would be 1, the second set would be 2, and so on.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList of report objects representing the retrieved rows of recipe items.

    • getRecipe

      public ArrayList<Integer> getRecipe(String item)
      Returns an ArrayList of integers representing the quantities of specific recipe items used in the specified item on the menu. The ArrayList has a fixed length equal to the number of items in the inventory, with each element representing the quantity of the corresponding inventory item used in the recipe.
      Parameters:
      item - the name of the menu item to query the recipe for
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of integers representing the quantities of specific recipe items used in the specified item on the menu
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an error executing the query

    • createOrder

      public void createOrder(double cost, ArrayList<CustomPair> menuItems, ArrayList<CustomPair> inventoryItems)
      Creates a new row in the orders table with the specified cost and list of menu items and inventory items.
      Parameters:
      cost - the cost of the order
      menuItems - a list of CustomPair objects representing the menu items and their corresponding quantities in the order
      inventoryItems - a list of CustomPair objects representing the inventory items and their corresponding quantities in the order
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an error executing the query

    • changePrice

      public void changePrice(String itemName, double newCost)
      Updates the cost of the specified menu item.
      Parameters:
      itemName - the name or ID of the menu item to update
      newCost - the new cost of the menu item

    • updateInventoryItem

      public void updateInventoryItem(String itemID, String itemName, String newCost, String quantity)
      Updates an inventory item with the specified ID with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      itemID - the ID of the inventory item to update
      itemName - the new name of the inventory item (can be empty string to skip update)
      newCost - the new cost of the inventory item (can be empty string to skip update)
      quantity - the new quantity of the inventory item (can be empty string to skip update)

    • updateRecipeItem

      public void updateRecipeItem(String itemID, String itemName, String invID, String menuID, String quantity)
      Updates a recipe item with the specified ID with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      itemID - the ID of the recipe item to update
      itemName - the new name of the recipe item (can be empty string to skip update)
      invID - the new inventory ID for the recipe item (can be empty string to skip update)
      menuID - the new menu ID for the recipe item (can be empty string to skip update)
      quantity - the new quantity of the recipe item (can be empty string to skip update)

    • createMenuItemSold

      private void createMenuItemSold(int MenuId, int orderID, int quantity)
      Create a new menu item sold and update inventory accordingly
      Parameters:
      MenuId - the ID of the menu item being sold
      orderID - the ID of the order this menu item is being sold under
      quantity - the quantity of the menu item being sold

    • createInventoryItemSold

      private void createInventoryItemSold(int InventoryId, int orderID, int quantity)
      Creates an item sold record for a given inventory item with the specified quantity and order ID. Finds the next available item ID by querying the maximum item ID from the item_sold table and adding 1 to it. Updates the item_sold table with the new record and updates the inventory_item table by reducing the quantity of the specified inventory item by the sold quantity.
      Parameters:
      quantity - the quantity of the inventory item being sold
      inventoryId - the ID of the inventory item being sold
      orderId - the ID of the order associated with the item sold record

    • getPriceOfMenuItem

      public double getPriceOfMenuItem(int itemID)
      Retrieve the cost of a menu item from the menu table based on its ID.
      Parameters:
      itemID - the ID of the menu item to get the price for.
      Returns:
      the cost of the menu item as a double.

      Returns:

    • addMenuItem

      public void addMenuItem(String name, double cost)
      Adds a new menu item to the restaurant's menu. The menu ID for the new item is the last menu ID + 1.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new menu item
      cost - the cost of the new menu item

    • addRecipeItem

      public void addRecipeItem(String name, int inventoryId, int menuId, int amtUsed)
      Adds a new recipe item to the restaurant's recipe book. The recipe ID for the new item is the last recipe ID + 1.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new recipe item
      inventoryId - the ID of the inventory item used in the recipe
      menuId - the ID of the menu item that the recipe item belongs to
      amtUsed - the amount of the inventory item used in the recipe

    • addInventoryItem

      public void addInventoryItem(String name, double cost, double quantity)
      Adds an inventory item to the database with the given name, cost, and quantity.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the inventory item
      cost - the cost of the inventory item
      quantity - the quantity of the inventory item

    • getNameFromID

      public String getNameFromID(int id)
      Gets the name of a menu item given its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the menu item to get the name of
      Returns:
      the name of the menu item with the given ID, or an empty string if no such item exists

      Parameters:
      initialDate - lowerbound for sales history interval
      finalDate - upperbound for sales history interval

    • popularCombos

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Combo> popularCombos(String initialDate, String finalDate)
      Retrieves a list of the 20 most popular menu item combos sold within a given date range.
      Parameters:
      initialDate - the start of the date range
      finalDate - the end of the date range
      Returns:
      an ObservableList of String arrays, each containing the names of two menu items that are frequently sold together
